answers.answer: the toe numbness occured from a nerve injury which occured from the parachute jump in '68.  diabetes also can cause numbness, but since you had this prior to diabetes...the etiology stems from trauma.  there is no medication that can bring back the feeling.  on the other hand, numbness from diabetes can cause discomfort, which can be relieved by some medications such as lyrica, neurontin, and cymbalta

question: i hurt my big toe in a parachute jump in 1968. my big toe has been numb every since. in 1984 i got diabetes, so now that i'm trying to get help for it they say is my diabetes what about the sixteen (16) years it was numb ? now the word ETIOLOGY comes into play
title: big toe trouble
